entry.title: Combined summary - LN summit organisation (nully0x)
entry.summary: Antoine Riard, a member of the lightning dev community, has proposed organizing the LN Summit in Africa in June 2024. He believes that Africa is a suitable location for the summit due to its rich cultural and historical past, fragmented financial systems, growing number of Lightning developers, and potential for local Lightning economies. Usually, the organization of such events is not announced publicly, but given the potential challenges of visas and tropical weather, Antoine suggests announcing it ahead of time. He also encourages a multi-stakeholder approach to ensure fairness and transparency.To start the planning process, Antoine plans to survey countries with operational stability, such as Algeria, Ghana, Senegal, and Nigeria. He has created a dedicated communication endpoint for this purpose. Antoine invites other Lightning developers to get involved in the organization of the summit, as it provides an opportunity for knowledge transfer between generations of contributors.The Lightning-dev Digest, Vol 94, Issue 17 has come to an end. The mailing list, hosted by the Linux Foundation, serves as a platform for discussions and developments related to lightning technology. To access the mailing list and stay updated on the latest news and insights, users can visit the foundation.org website and sign up. By joining the mailing list, individuals can actively participate in the conversation and contribute to the advancements in the field of lightning technology. To subscribe or unsubscribe from the mailing list, users can follow the link provided on the website.Stay connected with the Lightning-dev community and be a part of the ongoing discussions and innovations in this rapidly evolving domain.
